result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Anthony Puetz

records.addlTxt: Clerk: EZ. Defendant Mark Anthony Puetz not in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Mark Anthony Puetz.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 2:39 p.m. Atty. Buckett states has never met the defendant and defendant had been in the hospital.  Court gives cell number to counsel.  State requests stay be lifted on the warrant.  Atty. Buckett will attempt to call the defendant.  Court does not forfeit bond.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Mark Anthony Puetz not in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Mark Anthony Puetz.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 8:38 a.m.  Atty. Buckett states the defendant may be in the hospital due to medical issues.  State requests a warrant.  Court stays a warrant and if Atty. Buckett can have the defendant appear voluntarily or the court will issue a warrant.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
$1,000.00 signature bond continued

Defendant Mark Anthony Puetz in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court cancels warrant and continues $1000 signature bond as previously set.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Anthony Puetz in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Buckett appeared by phone for Mark Anthony Puetz. (22TR1344 & 22TR1345 Br. 3)  State inquires if there is an amount of cash that the defendant can post.  Atty. Buckett states based on defendant's health issues request that a signature bond be continued.  Defendant states missed court as was admitted to the hospital and then had confused the court date and request bond be reinstated.  Court reinstates the $1,000.00 signature bond and cancels the bail forfeiture.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
in custody

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Anthony Puetz does not appear.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Mark Anthony Puetz.   (22TR1344 & 22TR1345 Br. 3)  Case called at 9:15 a.m.  Atty. Buckett states believes defendant has been released but does not have an accurate phone number.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture and states basis.  Court lifts stay and issues warrant and bail forfeiture.
Reset Hearing time on June 30, 2022 from 9:45 a.m. to 08:15 a.m. at request of counsel.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Anthony Puetz not in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Mark Anthony Puetz.  Case called at 10:17 a.m.  Atty. Buckett states the defendant is in the hospital with an infection and unable to be released today and received treatment notes from the doctor.  State satisfied the defendant is in the hospital.  Court continues the stay the warrant.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Anthony Puetz in court, in custody.  Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco in court for Mark Anthony Puetz.  (22TR637; 22TR638)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  State requests $750.00 cash bond.  Atty. de Junco requests a signature bond.  Court reluctantly orders $1,000.00 signature bond.  Defendant states will return to court when ordered.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Hearing on May 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
